en: The game of Tug-of-war was an Olympic sport from 1900-1920.
The first rugby club was formed in 1843.
Draughts (checkers) is older than chess.
Joggers live, on average, six years longer.
The average golf ball has 336 dimples.
Tennis was originally played with bare hands.
The average pool cue is 1.4m (4.75ft) long.
The Olympic flag was designed in 1913.
Before 1850 golf balls were made of leather and were stuffed with feathers.
The average soccer ball is made up of 32 leather panels and held together by 642 stitches.
The 1912 Olympics were the last Olympics to give out medals made entirely of gold.
Butterfly was first a variant of Breaststroke, until it was accepted as a separate style in 1952.
The odds of getting a hole-in-one in golf are estimated at about 18,000-to-1.
Everton FC used to be called St Domingo's FC!
Olympic Badminton rules say that the bird has to have exactly fourteen feathers.
The Stanley Cup originally was only seven and a half inches high (19 cm).

The World Rubik's Cube championship was held in Budapest on June 5, 1982. Nineteen National Champions took part. The US Champion, won by solving the Cube in of 22.95 seconds. The world record, in competitive conditions, grew progressively lower and now stands at 4.59 seconds.
Dartboards are made out of horsehairs.
There are 8 979 564, possible ways to play the first four moves per side in a game of chess.
Bruce Lee was the Hong Kong 'cha cha' dance champion in 1958.
Most NASCAR Teams use nitrogen in their tires instead of air.
Did you know the average speed of a skydiver is 200 kph (124 mph)?
Paul Hornung holds the NFL record for the most points in a single season. He scored 176 points in 1960.
Two golf clubs claim to be the first established in the United States: the Foxberg Golf Club, Clarion County, PA (1887) and St. Andrews Golf Club of Yonkers, NY (1888).
Boxing is considered the easiest sport for gamblers to fix.

Karate, generally considered a Japanese martial art, did not come to Japan until 1916. Prior to this time it was practiced solely by the Okinawa islanders, who had developed it centuries earlier as a means of weaponless defense against the Japanese.
Seven out of every ten hockey-playing Canadians will lose a tooth during a game. For Canadians who don't play hockey, that figure drops to five out of ten.
The first baseball player to be named rookie of the year was Jackie Robinson in 1947.
In 1900 backstroke was included as an Olympic Event.
Canada beat Denmark 47-0 at the 1949 world hockey championships.
The forward pass was created by the football team at Saint Louis University.
Greece and Australia are the only countries to participate in all of the modern Olympics.
Did you know according to manufacturer Spalding the average lifespan of an NBA basketball is 10,000 bounces?
Howard Kinsey and Mrs. R. Roark, during a game of tennis, batted the ball back and forth 2001 consecutive times.
In 1935, Jesse Owens set six track and field world records in less than one hour.
